page.title: 03FOLKE CHURCH
page.content: The Church of St Lawrence is situated in the small parish of Folke and serves Alweston, Haydon, North Wootton and Folke. The church dates from l29l but only the Tower of that period remains - the remainder was rebuilt in l628 and restored in l875. The walls are of local rubble and free stone dressing and the roof is of stone slates. The interior is of Gothic style. Of the original five bells in the tower two remain, one cast in l628 and the other in l777. A cross and chain hangs in the church carved from one piece of limewood and consisting of 769 links, carved by Reverend Mayo Thornhill. Regular services are held at 8 a.m., ll a.m. and 6.30 p.m. on alternate Sundays and Sunday School every Sunday morning. The graveyard is full and burials take place at North Wootton.
